r.en: It was (the case) that during n days Bida at the place of the sheep did not stay. r.en: For the 1st time. r.en: Lugal-emaḫe has to investigate this. r.en: That it was for 8 of those days (that he did not stay there) r.en: in the statement of Bida it was confirmed. r.en: That it was for 1 day that the sheep with grass were not fed it was confirmed. r.en: Before Kas (as witness). r.en: (For the second time:) It was (the case) that during 15 days (Bida) at the place of the sheep did not stay. r.en: Akalla and Lugal-emaḫe have to investigate this. .en: That it was for 6 of those days (that he did not stay there) r.en: in the statement of Bida it was confirmed, r.en: That at Ka’ida for 1 day (the sheep) with barley were not fed r.en: Lukalla confirmed. r.en: In the statement of Bida it was confirmed. r.en: (Concerning) n+2 1/2 liters of barley that for the sheep were brought, r.en: Bida “It was not taken!” declared. r.en: Ara that (the barley) was taken has confirmed. r.en: That at Nippur during 2 days r.en: the sheep were with grass not fed and water to drink were not given .en: Ur-Šulpa’e has confirmed. .en: That with the male laborers who at the mill are serving (and) with the beer for the boats (Bida) was on duty .en: Kas has confirmed. .en: ... the sheep of the house ...: Ur-... has to investigate this. r.en: 1 barley-fed sheep: ... r.en: and Niĝduga have to investigate this. r.en: The tablet(s) of Bida ... . r.en: 19 gur 3 barig 1 ban2 barley, (according to the) royal (measure), r.en: from Ur-Damu; .en: deficit: 3 barig 2 ban2 9 1/3 sila3 various pulses, .en: 3 barig 3 ban2 1/2 sila3 8 shekels coriander, .en: 1 gur 4 barig 9 2/3 sila3 5 shekels sumac, .en: 4 ban2 2 sila3 u2-kur spice, en: 1 ban2 5 5/6 sila3 2 shekels cress seed, en: ... 2 sila3 18 shekels ku-mul spice, en: ... 4 ban2 1 sila3 zizibiānum spice en: (and) ... mana brick salt, en: it is the deficit; r.en: account of spices r.en: (of) Ur-Igalim, r.en: from month “Harvest,” r.en: to the extra month “Harvest,” r.en: it is 2 months. r.en: 5 gur 3 (?) barig 5 (?) ban2 emmer, royal (measure), r.en: (and) 32 gur 4 (?) barig 1 ... ban2 wheat, royal (measure), r.en: from (of) Lu-igimaše, r.en: under seal of Ur-Lamma, son (of) Ur-Baba, r.en: (from?) the depot of the field Aršatia-Nin-dar-a (?); r.en: month “Festival of Šulgi,” r.en: year “Simurum and Lullubum for the 9th time were destroyed.” r.en: Ur-Lamma, r.en: scribe, r.en: son (of) Ur-Baba. r.en: beard; r.en: voice of the herald; r.en: beautiful voice of the herald. r.en: Holy An, the great words of his mouth are not to be abrogated. r.en: The great gods bow down to him, like a curved staff, in approval of and in prayer to him.  r.en: What you command is just. (Like) what a prince or lord has uttered, what you have commanded is obeyed. r.en: An, your lofty command takes precedence, who would say No to you? r.en: Father of the gods, your word, the foundation of heaven and earth, no god fails to heed it.  r.en: Lord, you are the leader who takes only his own counsel, what should be our counsel? r.en: Grant your strength to the maiden Ištar, whom you have loved.   r.en: Your reliable approval, weighty as heaven, make known (to her) in our assembly.  r.en: Give to the mistress, whom you have loved, your combined divine powers.   .en: Let Kišar truly be the spouse equal with you, may she rise to the (equivalent) authority of your name.  .en: Moreover, in addition let her carry out herself the decrees of Enlil and Enki.    .en: When she alone has taken hold of the nose-rope of heaven and earth, she shall be our strength! .en: For An, the pleasant conversation produced happiness..en: He in his goodness of heart treated holy Inanna well.   .en: The commands of my Anu-ship are the complex fundament(?) of heaven which cannot be equaled.  .en: My fixed boundaries whose exteriors are fearsome and know no approaching, .en: I am Anšar/Anu, the king's helper, do take hold of their band.   .en: Do take for yourself the entire extent of their territory, exercise alone the ruling of them!.en: Come, rise up to my dais of kingship and dwell in the heights!.en: Corresponding to my called name, may Exalted Kišar/Antu be your called name! .en: My faithful vizier, whose lips are prized, who is aware of my secrets, .en: Ninšubur, my fitting vizier, shall exercise the status of father with you. .en: May he (standing) before you constantly present auspicious words from (every) god and goddess. .en: At the eternal foundation of heaven and earth and by the enduring designs of the gods,  .en: when, in the beginning, Anu, Enlil and Ea allotted the shares, r.en: for the two gods, the watchmen of heaven and netherworld, the ones who open the door of Anu,r.en: for moon-god and sun-god the night and day were made in equal parts, r.en: and from the bottom of heaven to the top of heaven they assign them their tasks: r.en: to keep all the stars of heaven on course as in a furrow, r.en: to make the leading gods keep to their paths like oxen. r.en: Up into that place, Inanna, rise to the rulership of them all! r.en: Lady, you be the brightest of them, so may they call you Ištar of the Stars!  r.en: May your high position (relative to them) alternate between the two sides (east and west) triumphantly!r.en: May your splendor be as abundant as that of the moon and sun in (their) watches. .en: May the flaring glow of your torch shine high in the sky!  .en: May the people marvel at you as one for whom among the gods there is none to check up on her..en: After the lord had bestowed (these) great powers upon the daughter of Sîn, .en: he did not keep her away from the shrine Eanna, her sacred chamber..en: After king Anu had bestowed the great powers upon her, .en: they presented to her the shrine Eanna, her sacred chamber. .en: He covered her figure with the ceremonial garment of Anu-hood, the brilliant splendor of Sîn..en: He made her appear like the day with superb ornaments, the ornaments of divinity. .en: He enhanced her arm with the scepter of kingship, the fierce wood (staff), the unsparing weapon.   .en: A glorious crown which is like (that on) the head of Nanna he set (firmly) upon her head.  .en: O Hierodule, my important decisions, divine powers which could not be asked for (by anyone else) I have assigned to you. .en: Like me, may Enlil, king of all the lands, treat you well!  .en: Because of this Lord Nunamnira became happy, his liver surged with joy..en: 3rd tablet of Exalted Lady Who Alone is Mighty, not finished..en: Tablet of {m}21-35-35-26-44, son of {m}21-11-20-42. r.en: Holy An, the great words of his mouth are not to be abrogated. r.en: The great gods bown down to him, like a curved staff, in approval of and in prayer to him.  r.en: What you command is just. (Like) what a prince or lord has uttered, what you have commanded is obeyed. r.en: An, your lofty command takes precedence, who would say No to you? r.en: Father of the gods, your word, the foundation of heaven and earth, no god fails to heed it.  r.en: Lord, you are the leader who takes only his own counsel, what should be our counsel? r.en: Grant your strength to the maiden Ištar, whom you have loved.   r.en: Your reliable approval, weighty as heaven, make known (to her) in our assembly.  r.en: Give to the mistress, whom you have loved, your combined divine powers.   .en: Let Kišar/Antu truly be the spouse equal with you, may she rise to the (equivalent) authority of your name.  .en: Moreover, in addition let her carry out herself the decrees of Enlil and Enki.    r.en: When she alone has taken hold of the nose-rope of heaven and earth, she shall be our strength! r.en: For An, the pleasant conversation produced happiness.r.en: He in his goodness of heart treated holy Inanna well.   r.en: The commands of my Anu-ship are the complex fundament(?) of heaven which cannot be equaled.  r.en: My fixed boundaries whose exteriors are fearsome and know no approaching, r.en: I am Anšar/Anu, the king's helper, do take hold of their band.   r.en: Take for yourself the entire extent of their territory, exercise alone the rule of them!r.en: Come, rise up to my dais of kingship and the arrowhead that pierces lungs and heart go back and forth like a shuttle. r.en: Inanna, after you have made fighting and battle flip about(?) like a skip-rope, r.en: O lady of battle, make them clash together like a ball(?) and driving stick. r.en: Goddess of contention, make battle be pursued like puppets=dolls being manipulated. r.en: Lady, at the place of clashing of weapons, strike with chaos like the banging down of astragals. r.en: Inanna, when like an overwhelming storm you are consolidating the contingents of battle, r.en: when you demonstrate your great ability with the divine mace, the double-headed ax, the big sword and arrows,  r.en: when you put on the fierce armor, let the deluge rage. r.en: When you make ready your bow/throw-stick(?) and shield of battle, may the storms whirl about for you. .en: May your raging divine weapon strike the evil person with lightning like (the plague god) Erra. .en: Lady, at the place of clashing of weapons and planting of standards, no one can get away from the opening of your arms. .en: My daughter, wherever it is pleasing to you to extend upwards, to extend downwards, to pull taut or to loosen, .en: Having no limits at the place where destinies are decided, your pronouncements are indeed as great as my pronouncements. .en: At festivals, offerings, banquets, prostration(?), making obeisance, and invoking the name (of the god), .en: a human being whose god has gotten very angry with him, whose goddess has become soured/jealous towards him, .en: as long as he does not seek out the place of reconciliation with your divinity, no god will be agreeable to his petition. .en: At my city, the mountain of Sumer and Akkad, the shade of the world quarters, r.en: at Duranki, the bond of heaven and earth, the foundation of all constructed settlements,  r.en: at my royal dais reposing like a horned bull (or elephant?) at the obeisances of the gods, r.en: at my sanctuary Nippur, the shrine of Enlil-ship, the mainstay/great wall of the nation, r.en: the sanctuary, the relaxing dwelling place which is called by my name, r.en: may your ladyship also be manifested in that place, may your name be called Queen of Nippur! r.en: The good protective spirit, (my) eloquent god who is standing in front of me, r.en: the craftsman of the centerpoint of the Ekur temple, discoverer of advice and planning, the finest oil, r.en: let be your guardian be he against whom your wrath was great and whom your divine fury has overcome. r.en: May wise Nin-imma'imma cool your heart with pleasant conversations. .en: Lady, I have established for you my weighty commands, divine powers that should not be demanded by anyone; .en: as I (have done), may Ea, king of the Apsu, treat you well. .en: Because of this, the prince Mother, my words, in the day, in the dream. en: Inside the dream there was one man, his greatness was like heaven, en: his greatness was like the earth. en: He, according to his head he was a god, en: according to his arm he was the Anzu, en: according to his lower body he was the flood. en: Lions lay by his right and left. en: He spoke to me about the building of his house. en: His ‘heart’ I did not understand. en: A light went up on the horizon for me. en: There was one woman. Who was it, who was it not? en: going up to the top she made a haystack on the earth. en: She held a stylus of purified silver in the hand. en: She had the tablet of the stars on her lap. en: She counseled it. en: Secondly, it was a hero, en: he bent the arm, he held a lapis writing board in the hand, en: he drew the plan of the house. en: In front of me stood a shiny basket, en: a shiny mold was made ready, en: the brick of deciding destinies was placed in the mold for me. en: In a just poplar standing in front of me, en: a ‘tibu’-bird passed the time tweeting. en: A donkey stallion, on seven days no barley was ground. en: The slave woman was made equal with her mistress, en: and by the slave en: his master stood side by side. en: In my city the sexually impure with respect to him must put it to any other use, en: and so it is (made only of) diorite. en: Let it stand at the place of libations. en: By an act of force en: let no one destroy it. en: O statue, before you en: is .en: for Šulgi, born for a prosperous reign, from the womb on he was destined for greatness. .en: Unifier of the people, .en: (you) who unto distant (time) is king of multitudes! .en: A runner, a tempestuous storm, whose loins keep going, .en: a runner who leaves behind all the settlements, .en: a frightening force, fiercest of all racers, .en: chosen from all the people, their strength, who ... the head. .en: when (his) tall arms are spread wide, toward his back ... .en: Šulgi, whose speeding has been repeatedly set(? from the horizon(?), .en: Because of his great strength, in his arms ever-expanding(?) ..., .en: tirelessly traveling powerfully(?) upon the road. .en: Among the Black Headed People no king had dared so much; he reached a great decision. .en: On a day that broke joyously, with clouds set for rain, .en: from the Ki'ur terrace of Nippur he decided to run .en: to the shrine of Ur, the Etemenniguru. .en: For Nanna in the morning dining hall where stood his princely bowl he provided the fitting regular offerings. .en: On this day he determined abundance as its fate. .en: A storm wind from the south(?), a whirlwind, broke out. .en: The sun dipped low in parallel, .en: but he arrived(?) back at the lapis lazuli Ekur. .en: That heroes for (future) lifetimes .en: would reveal in praise the very great magnificence of Šulgi, .en: his statue of distant days and eternal fame, .en: like the heavenly stars he colored it, .en: and by exalted father Enlil, him with unalterable verdicts, .en: with his good eyes, filled with delight, (clothed) with a princely garment, he set it up. r.en: To Igalima, r.en: the beloved son r.en: of Ningirsu, r.en: his master, r.en: Šulgi, r.en: the mighty man, r.en: king of Ur r.en: and king of Sumer and Akkad,
